name: Welcome to TreeListy
description: Your ideas deserve structure. TreeListy transforms thoughts into organized, actionable trees. This guide walks you through everything - try clicking around!

hyperedges.name: Dual View System
hyperedges.description: Same data, two perspectives - Tree View for editing, Canvas View for visualization

hyperedges.name: AI Creation Pipeline
hyperedges.description: Build ‚Üí Import ‚Üí Enhance ‚Üí Analyze: AI assists at every stage

hyperedges.name: Collaboration Workflow
hyperedges.description: Share ‚Üí Tag edits ‚Üí Comment ‚Üí Sync: Complete collaboration toolkit

hyperedges.name: Canvas-Specific Features
hyperedges.description: Visual features that shine in Canvas View - drag nodes, see connections, create hyperedges

hyperedges.name: Start Here
hyperedges.description: Three paths to begin: Start fresh, import existing work, or let AI build it

children.name: Getting Started
children.subtitle: Your first 2 minutes
children.description: The essentials to get you productive right away. Each item below teaches a core concept.

items.name: Tree View
items.description: You're looking at it! A structured outline where you can expand/collapse sections. Click the arrows (‚ñ∂) to toggle. Great for detailed editing and data entry.

subtasks.name: Click arrows to expand/collapse
subtasks.description: Try it now - click the ‚ñ∂ next to any phase or item

subtasks.name: Click any node to see details
subtasks.description: The detail panel appears on the right with all fields

items.name: Canvas View
items.description: You're seeing it now! Drag nodes anywhere. Zoom with scroll wheel. See colored lines connecting related nodes - those are hyperedges. Try the layout dropdown for different arrangements.

subtasks.name: Drag nodes to rearrange
subtasks.description: Click and drag any node to move it freely on the canvas

subtasks.name: Try different layouts
subtasks.description: Use the layout dropdown for Timeline, Radial, Force-Directed views

items.name: 3D Knowledge Navigator
items.description: Click the üåê button to explore your tree in 3D space! Nodes become spheres you can orbit around. Great for large trees - see the big picture from any angle.

subtasks.name: Drag to orbit around
subtasks.description: Click and drag to rotate the view in any direction

subtasks.name: Hover nodes for details
subtasks.description: Move your mouse over any sphere to see its name and info

items.name: Right-Click Menu
items.description: Right-click any node for a menu of actions: Add Child, Edit, Duplicate, Delete, Share Branch, and more. This is how you build and modify your tree.

children.name: AI Superpowers
children.subtitle: Let AI do the heavy lifting
children.description: TreeListy's AI features help you think, organize, and create faster. All powered by Claude, Gemini, or ChatGPT - you choose.

items.name: Chat Builder
items.description: Click 'üí¨ Chat Builder' in the sidebar. Describe your project in plain English - AI builds the structure through conversation. Great for starting from scratch.

subtasks.name: Example: 'Plan a weekend trip to Portland'
subtasks.description: AI will ask clarifying questions, then build a complete tree

items.name: Import Text
items.description: Click 'üì• Import Text' to paste any document, outline, or notes. AI extracts the structure automatically. Quick Mode for simple docs, Deep Mode for complex analysis.

subtasks.name: Quick Mode: Fast extraction
subtasks.description: For meeting notes, simple outlines, straightforward documents

subtasks.name: Deep Mode: Extended thinking
subtasks.description: For academic papers, complex arguments, detailed analysis

items.name: Smart Expand
items.description: Click '‚ú® Smart Expand' to have AI enrich your existing tree. It adds subtasks, fills descriptions, and suggests missing pieces - without deleting your work.

items.name: Deep Dive Analysis
items.description: Select any node, right-click ‚Üí 'Deep Dive'. AI performs scholarly analysis: key concepts, implications, related ideas, counterarguments. Perfect for research.

items.name: Debate Mode
items.description: Right-click any node ‚Üí 'Debate This Topic'. Watch two AI personas debate - one Defender, one Challenger. Choose argument styles (Scholar, Socratic, Passionate, Pragmatist). Extract insights as pro/con/tension/question to your tree.

children.name: 21 Specialized Patterns
children.subtitle: Purpose-built templates
children.description: TreeListy adapts to your domain. Each pattern has custom fields, AI personas, and workflows optimized for that use case. Includes LifeTree for biographies and Custom for your own fields.

items.name: Change Pattern
items.description: Click the pattern dropdown in the header (shows 'Generic Project' by default). Switch patterns anytime - your data is preserved and mapped to new fields.

items.name: Available Patterns
items.description: Generic Project, CAPEX, Philosophy, Sales Pipeline, Academic Thesis, Product Roadmap, Prompt Engineering, Book Writing, Event Planning, Fitness Program, Strategic Plan, Course Design, AI Video (Veo3/Sora2), Family Tree, Dialogue & Rhetoric, Gmail Workflow, File System, Free Speech, LifeTree (biographies), and Custom (your own fields).

subtasks.name: Philosophy: Arguments, premises, dialectics
subtasks.description: Perfect for analyzing debates, building arguments, Socratic dialogue

subtasks.name: Sales: Deals, probability, contacts
subtasks.description: Track your pipeline with deal values, close dates, and win probability

subtasks.name: AI Video: Sora/Veo production prompts
subtasks.description: Generate camera movements, lighting, and video prompts for AI video tools

children.name: Collaboration
children.subtitle: Work together
children.description: Share trees with teammates, track who edited what, and sync changes in real-time or asynchronously.

items.name: Share via URL
items.description: Click 'Share' in header ‚Üí Copy link ‚Üí Anyone can open your exact tree instantly. No account needed. Large trees use Cloud Share (Firebase short URLs) automatically. Share links can capture your current view state too!

items.name: Contributor Tags
items.description: Edit any node ‚Üí scroll to 'Collaboration' section ‚Üí set your name. Your edits show a üë§ badge so collaborators know who changed what.

items.name: Collaboration Comments
items.description: Leave notes for teammates in the 'Collaboration Comments' field. Nodes with comments show a pulsing üí¨ indicator so they're easy to spot.
items.collabComments: This is an example comment! You can use this field to ask questions, leave feedback, or coordinate with collaborators.

items.name: Watch Mode
items.description: Click 'üëÅÔ∏è Watch Mode' in sidebar for real-time sync. Point it at a shared file (Google Drive, OneDrive) and it polls for changes every 5-60 seconds.

children.name: Power Features
children.subtitle: Canvas-specific tools
children.description: These features shine in Canvas View - visual connections, dependencies, and project tracking.

items.name: Hyperedges
items.description: The colored lines connecting nodes in this view! Click the hyperedge panel (bottom-right) to create your own. Group related concepts across phases with visual connections.

items.name: Dependencies
items.description: Link items that must complete before others can start. Edit an item ‚Üí Dependencies field ‚Üí select prerequisites. Dependencies show as arrows between nodes.

items.name: Project Tracking
items.description: Each item has status (To Do, In Progress, Done), assignee, due date, priority, and progress percentage. This node shows example values - check the detail panel!

items.name: Export Options
items.description: File menu ‚Üí Export as Excel (4-sheet workbook), JSON (for backup/sharing), or generate AI prompts from your tree structure.

children.name: Your Next Steps
children.subtitle: Start creating
children.description: Ready to build your own tree? Here are some ways to begin.

items.name: Start Fresh
items.description: File menu ‚Üí New Tree. Choose a pattern that fits your project. Then use Chat Builder or just start adding phases manually.

items.name: Import Existing Work
items.description: Have notes, docs, or outlines? Use Import Text to convert them into a structured tree. AI handles the organization.

items.name: Save Your Work
items.description: TreeListy auto-saves to your browser, but also save as JSON (File ‚Üí Save) for backup. You can reload it anytime, on any device.
